item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, February 8, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. No-Libc Zig Now Outperforms Glibc Zig (63 points | 36 comments)
2. Carbon is not a programming language (sort of) (18 points | 4 comments)
3. Three Years of Ephemeral NixOS: My Experience Resetting Root on Every Boot (21 points | 8 comments)
4. Synctrain: a rethought iOS client for Syncthing (11 points | 9 comments)
5. Be Skeptical of All Code - Not Just the Funny Stuff (7 points | 1 comment)
6. Gleam v1.8.0 released (70 points | 16 comments)
7. AI haters build tarpits to trap and trick AI scrapers that ignore robots.txt (23 points | 11 comments)
8. getaddrinfo sucks. everything else is much worse (30 points | 15 comments)
9. We are destroying software (16 points | 15 comments)
10. CPython tail-call interpreter merged for Python 3.14, a 10% speedup in benchmarks (45 points | 18 comments)
11. AI exploits a gamebreaking bug in Trackmania (3 points | no comments)
12. Consuming the jetstream atproto firehose correctly (1 points | no comments)
13. A Simple Serialization System (2 points | no comments)
14. Lume, an MIT-licensed CLI to virtualize macOS environments (9 points | 1 comment)
15. The case for sans-io (4 points | 7 comments)
16. From hours to 360ms: over-engineering a puzzle solution (1 points | no comments)
17. Refined: simple refinement types for Rust (13 points | 9 comments)
18. Trivalent: A hardened chromium for desktop Linux inspired by Vanadium (3 points | 1 comment)
19. Docker Bake is Now Generally Available (9 points | 2 comments)
20. Fun Friday: what's the weirdest automation you've ever made? (15 points | 40 comments)
21. You Didn't Notice MP3 Is Now Free (54 points | 45 comments)
22. A tale of several distros joining forces for a common goal: reproducible builds (3 points | no comments)
23. Comments on Shared Unix Hosting vs. the Cloud (30 points | 62 comments)
24. Cloudflare incident on February 6, 2025 (19 points | 1 comment)
25. polysubml-demo: A simple ML-like language with subtyping, polymorphism, higher rank types, and global type inference (13 points | 2 comments)
